title: Mass. woman killed while sunbathing after car drives through residential pool area in Florida
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A Massachusetts woman, 65-year-old Anastasia Fiona Allman, was killed when a Jeep crashed into a pool area in Fort Pierce, Florida.
The 38-year-old Jeep driver may have experienced a medical episode; she drove off-road and struck Allman while sunbathing.
The Fort Pierce incident remains under investigation; the driver was treated at a hospital and released in stable condition.

title: Review & setlist: Brandi Carlile has tailored her ‘Human Tour’ to humans, beautifully
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Brandi Carlile performed her first arena tour show in Boston at TD Garden on February 12, 2026.
Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey declared the day as 'Brandi Carlile Day' during Carlile's Boston concert.
Carlile's setlist featured songs from her 2025 album, 'Human,' and fan-requested performances, ending with an encore.

title: Delta is bringing back direct flights between Boston and Hawaii
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Delta Air Lines to resume Boston to Honolulu nonstop flights starting December 19, 2026.
Flights will initially be daily during the peak holiday, then reduce to four times weekly.
The route, on an Airbus A330-300, was previously suspended in 2025 due to low demand.

title: A renovated Lake Winnipesaukee escape, plus new nonstop flights to Canada
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mill Falls Resort on Lake Winnipesaukee finishes a years-long renovation, offering a stay in a historic 19th-century linen mill.
Porter Airlines will launch two nonstop routes from Boston to Montréal and Toronto in May, expanding Canada travel options.
Portland Harbor Hotel offers a Girlfriends Getaway Package featuring dining credits, valet parking, and complimentary bikes.

title: Brayan Bello reflects on rough playoff start, enters Red Sox camp with new pitch
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Brayan Bello added a curveball to his pitch repertoire at Red Sox spring training after a rough 2025 postseason.
Bello had a rocky final month in 2025, going 1-3 with a 5.40 ERA over five starts in September.
The Red Sox bolstered their rotation with Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, who will pitch ahead of Bello in 2026.

title: A popular Vermont ski resort is under new ownership
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Smugglers' Notch Resort in Jeffersonville was acquired by Vermont-based Bear Den Partners from Bill Stritzler.
Bear Den Partners plans to maintain the resort's family-friendly focus and improve infrastructure and guest experience.
The Stritzler family retains a stake; Bill Stritzler's daughter, Lisa Howe, will serve as an advisor.

title: Mass. senators push bill that could allow residents to sue ICE agents
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts senators introduce bill allowing lawsuits against federal officers for constitutional violations, focusing on ICE agents.
The bill is part of Massachusetts Senate's 'Response 2025' against Trump administration's immigration policies.
The legislation maintains 'qualified immunity' but applies liability to federal officers for excessive force use.

title: Six arrested in Springfield drug and gun trafficking busts
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Massachusetts State Police arrested six people in Springfield during two operations targeting drug and gun trafficking.
Authorities seized 15 handguns, six rifles, fentanyl, 8.5 kg of cocaine, and $63,000 in cash.
Operations involved multiple agencies, including the FBI, focusing on trafficking rings linked to Massachusetts and Puerto Rico.

title: Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency after CEO’s name appears in Epstein files
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency due to founder Casey Wasserman's name appearing in Epstein-related files.
Emails between Casey Wasserman and Ghislaine Maxwell surfaced, prompting entertainers like Chappell Roan and Orville Peck to leave Wasserman.
Despite calls for resignation, Wasserman continues as LA28 Chair after a board review of his interactions with Epstein and Maxwell.

title: Video: Water pours into South Station from newly renovated ceiling
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A maintenance worker damaged a sprinkler line, causing water to pour into South Station's exterior concourse.
The incident occurred under the newly renovated ceiling, but train service remained unaffected, according to the MBTA.
The station cleanup was completed by Thursday, with the worker employed by Hines Development, the tower's developer.
